text: The 2002 Fed Cup was the 40th edition of the most important competition between national teams in women's tennis. The final took place at the Palacio de Congresos de Maspalomas in Gran Canaria, Spain on 2–3 November. Slovakia defeated Spain, giving Slovakia their first title. ==World Group== {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- !colspan=4|Participating Teams |- !style="width:25%;"| !style="width:25%;"| !style="width:25%;"| !style="width:25%;"| |- ! ! ! ! |- ! ! ! ! |- ! ! ! ! |} ===Draw=== ==World Group Play-offs== The eight losing teams in the World Group first round ties and eight winners of the Zonal Group I sections competed in the World Group Play-offs for spots in the 2003 World Group. ===Group II=== Venue: Pretoria, South Africa (outdoor hard) Dates: 9–13 April ;Participating Teams * * * '''''' * * * '''''' * '''''' * * * * * * '''''' * ==Year-End Rankings== The Fed Cup rankings were first instated on 4 November 2002, and were measured by combining points earned from the previous four years.
